column4: is there anyway to change my mac address and be able to use the internet without rebooting?
i'm running ubuntu from virtualbox btw
have you tried addressing the device with ifconfig directly "ifconfig eth0 up && dhclient eth0"
i did that then what am i supposed to do
post the output of ifconfig here if possible
here is the output of the command u told me: http://imageshack.us/photo/my-images/811/unledbhp.png/
it seems you have gotten an ip from the virtualbox NAT. try pinging a fixed ip like googles DNS server (8.8.8.8)
it says unreachable wen i ping 8.8.8.8
okay. the computer you're running Vbox on is the machine you are using right now to chat?
alright, does this machine have several LAN ports?
okay you need to check your adapter settings in VBox
set it to bridged if you have to (at least for now) and be sure to select the active LANcontroller as the bridging device
are you using VBox in linux?
k then forget what I just said
VBox probably has a problem with the adapter Mac not matching it's config in Vbox itself
you were able to get a connection with the new mac before?
